column4: Hey guys. A new Linux user here who needs help formatting my drive. It doesn't work... Can someone help me?

i'd certainly use the gui, or use "parted" instead of fdisk. if the computer is more or less brand new it might have gpt/uefi in which case fdisk is not the correct partitioning tool. you dont get any warnings messages from fdisk?

Yeah, there was a warning, good you mentioned it. Problem is, everything fucked up when I tried to install new nVidia drivers. X broke completely. When I tried to fix it, I ended up with just a black screen with a blinking caret. Now running from bootUSB to reformat and redo everything.
one sec, I'll check the warning.

error is "WARNING: Re-reading the partition table failed with error 22: Invalid argument. The kernel still uses the old table. The new table will be used at the next reboot or after you run partprobe(8) or kpartx(8)"
thats usually not a problem. just means you need to run the command partprobe to get the kernel to update the table, once you reboot the kernel will reread anyways
I figured, but it doesn't. I
so how old is the motherboard on this computer?
that would likely rule out uefi (unless its a mac)
if the data on the disk can be trashed you could try a low level command to blow away the table. "dd bs=512 if=/dev/zero of=/dev/sda count=1"
make sure /dev/sda is the correct device first
sda is probably the internal hard drive and sdb is the probably the usb boot disk
are you removing the usb stick before trying to reboot?
when you say "boot disk" thats really confusing. the "boot disk" is whatever you boot from. it could be the internal hdd or the liveusb install device
seems the bootable USB had been erased somehow. Maybe I did it myself accidentally =) Seems it's coming along now ^
